Objective: Assess ease of opening pudding container in microgravity
Procedure: Crew member retrieves sealed pudding cup from stowage, opens it slowly in front of camera
Risks_and_Mitigation: Floating_droplets_of_pudding – use napkin and ventilation capture protocols
Pass_Criteria: No free-floating blobs larger than 1 cm and crew rates opening difficulty <= 3 on 1–5 scale

Objective: Evaluate spoon handling and portion control
Procedure: Crew scoops standard bites (approx. 5 g) and moves spoon from cup to mouth 10 times
Risks_and_Mitigation: Spills into cabin – perform near air intake screen and have wipes ready
Pass_Criteria: At least 9 of 10 spoon transfers successful without visible free-floating droplets

Objective: Evaluate taste perception vs. Earth baseline
Procedure: Each crew member tastes three spoonfuls and rates flavor, sweetness, creaminess
Risks_and_Mitigation: Taste_fatigue – schedule test away from large meals

Objective: Assess mouthfeel and texture perception in microgravity
Procedure: Crew takes two normal bites and one larger bite, focusing on texture and afterfeel
Risks_and_Mitigation: Crumbs_or_grains_floating – instruct crew to keep lips sealed while chewing

Objective: Measure crumb and droplet behavior with toppings
Procedure: Crew applies topping, stirs gently for 30 s, then eats 5 bites
Risks_and_Mitigation: High_particle_generation – limit stirring speed and quantity_of_topping
Pass_Criteria: No more_than_3_particles_larger_than_2_mm observed floating after 60 s

Objective: Assess packaging suitability for repeated small servings
Procedure: Crew opens pouch, dispenses 5 small servings over 30 min, resealing between servings
Risks_and_Mitigation: Leakage_onto_surfaces – perform over absorbent_pad and inspect after_each_use

Objective: Evaluate compatibility with scheduled activities and workload
Procedure: Crew consumes pudding during a standard work block break (<=10 min)
Crew eats 1 serving and reports satiety and thirst at 0, 30, and 90 minutes

Objective: Test cleaning effort and residue behavior
Procedure: Crew intentionally leaves minor residue in cup and on spoon, then follows standard cleaning protocol

Objective: Overall acceptability and menu inclusion decision
Procedure: Crew samples favorite flavor, completes global evaluation on taste, handling, messiness, mood_effect
